get.description: Get all available widget metadata in alphabetical order, including widgets marked with isVisibleFromCatalog == false.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

put.description: Update the name and position of dashboards in the supplied group, and remove omitted dashboards. Does not modify dashboard content.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: team
parameters.description: Team ID or team name

delete.description: Delete a dashboard given its ID. This also deletes the widgets associated with this dashboard.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: dashboardId
parameters.description: ID of the dashboard to delete.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description: Team ID or team name

get.description: Get a dashboard by its ID.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: team
parameters.description: Team ID or team name

put.description: Replace configuration for the specified dashboard. Replaces Widget list on Dashboard, only if property is supplied.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The Configuration of the dashboard to replace.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: dashboardId
parameters.description: ID of the dashboard to replace.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description: Team ID or team name

post.description: Create a widget on the specified dashboard.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: State of the widget to add

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: dashboardId
parameters.description: ID of dashboard the widget will be added to.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description: Team ID or team name

put.description: Replace the widgets on specified dashboard with the supplied widgets.

parameters.description: ID of the Dashboard to modify.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description: Team ID or team name

parameters.name: eTag
parameters.description: Dashboard Widgets Version

patch.description: Update the supplied widgets on the dashboard using supplied state. State of existing Widgets not passed in the widget list is preserved.

parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The set of widget states to update on the dashboard.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: dashboardId
parameters.description: ID of the Dashboard to modify.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description: Team ID or team name

parameters.name: eTag
parameters.description: Dashboard Widgets Version

parameters.name: dashboardId
parameters.description: ID of the dashboard containing the widget.

parameters.name: widgetId
parameters.description: ID of the widget to update.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description: Team ID or team name

copyDashboardScope.description: Dashboard Scope. Can be either Project or Project_Team

values.description: [DEPRECATED] Dashboard is scoped to the collection user.
Dashboard is scoped to the team.
Dashboard is scoped to the project.

copyQueriesFlag.description: When this flag is set to true,option to select the folder to copy Queries of copy dashboard will appear.

projectId.description: ID of the project. Provided by service at creation time.

queryFolderPath.description: Path to which the queries should be copied of copy dashboard

teamId.description: ID of the team. Provided by service at creation time

dashboardScope.description: Entity to which the dashboard is scoped.

values.description: [DEPRECATED] Dashboard is scoped to the collection user.
Dashboard is scoped to the team.
Dashboard is scoped to the project.

eTag.description: Server defined version tracking value, used for edit collision detection.

groupId.description: ID of the group for a dashboard. For team-scoped dashboards, this is the unique identifier for the team associated with the dashboard. For project-scoped dashboards this property is empty.

id.description: ID of the Dashboard. Provided by service at creation time.

modifiedBy.description: Id of the person who modified Dashboard.

ownerId.description: ID of the owner for a dashboard. For team-scoped dashboards, this is the unique identifier for the team associated with the dashboard. For project-scoped dashboards, this is the unique identifier for the user identity associated with the dashboard.

position.description: Position of the dashboard, within a dashboard group. If unset at creation time, position is decided by the service.

refreshInterval.description: Interval for client to automatically refresh the dashboard. Expressed in minutes.

widgets.description: The set of Widgets on the dashboard.

DashboardGroup.description: Describes a list of dashboards associated to an owner. Currently, teams own dashboard groups.

dashboardEntries.description: A list of Dashboards held by the Dashboard Group

permission.description: Deprecated: The old permission model describing the level of permissions for the current team. Pre-M125.

teamDashboardPermission.description: A permissions bit mask describing the security permissions of the current team for dashboards. When this permission is the value None, use GroupMemberPermission. Permissions are evaluated based on the presence of a value other than None, else the GroupMemberPermission will be saved.

DashboardGroupEntry.description: Dashboard group entry, wrapping around Dashboard (needed?)

DashboardGroupEntryResponse.description: Response from RestAPI when saving and editing DashboardGroupEntry

height.description: Height of desired lightbox, in pixels

resizable.description: True to allow lightbox resizing, false to disallow lightbox resizing, defaults to false.

width.description: Width of desired lightbox, in pixels

ReferenceLinks.description: The class to represent a collection of REST reference links.

links.description: The readonly view of the links.  Because Reference links are readonly, we only want to expose them as read only.

SemanticVersion.description: versioning for an artifact as described at: http://semver.org/, of the form major.minor.patch.

major.description: Major version when you make incompatible API changes

minor.description: Minor version when you add functionality in a backwards-compatible manner

patch.description: Patch version when you make backwards-compatible bug fixes

TeamContext.description: The Team Context for an operation.

project.description: The team project Id or name.  Ignored if ProjectId is set.

projectId.description: The Team Project ID.  Required if Project is not set.

team.description: The Team Id or name.  Ignored if TeamId is set.

VssJsonCollectionWrapper.description: This class is used to serialize collections as a single JSON object on the wire.

allowedSizes.description: Refers to the allowed sizes for the widget. This gets populated when user wants to configure the widget

areSettingsBlockedForUser.description: Read-Only Property from Dashboard Service. Indicates if settings are blocked for the current user.

artifactId.description: Refers to unique identifier of a feature artifact. Used for pinning+unpinning a specific artifact.

contributionId.description: The id of the underlying contribution defining the supplied Widget Configuration.

dashboard.description: Optional partial dashboard content, to support exchanging dashboard-level version ETag for widget-level APIs

WidgetMetadata.description: Contribution based information describing Dashboard Widgets.

analyticsServiceRequired.description: Opt-in boolean that indicates if the widget requires the Analytics Service to function. Widgets requiring the analytics service are hidden from the catalog if the Analytics Service is not available.

catalogIconUrl.description: Resource for an icon in the widget catalog.

catalogInfoUrl.description: Opt-in URL string pointing at widget information. Defaults to extension marketplace URL if omitted

configurationContributionId.description: The id of the underlying contribution defining the supplied Widget custom configuration UI. Null if custom configuration UI is not available.

configurationContributionRelativeId.description: The relative id of the underlying contribution defining the supplied Widget custom configuration UI. Null if custom configuration UI is not available.

configurationRequired.description: Indicates if the widget requires configuration before being added to dashboard.

contentUri.description: Uri for the widget content to be loaded from .

contributionId.description: The id of the underlying contribution defining the supplied Widget.

defaultSettings.description: Optional default settings to be copied into widget settings.

isEnabled.description: Widgets can be disabled by the app store.  We'll need to gracefully handle for: - persistence (Allow) - Requests (Tag as disabled, and provide context)

isNameConfigurable.description: Opt-out boolean that indicates if the widget supports widget name/title configuration. Widgets ignoring the name should set it to false in the manifest.

isVisibleFromCatalog.description: Opt-out boolean indicating if the widget is hidden from the catalog. Commonly, this is used to allow developers to disable creation of a deprecated widget. A widget must have a functional default state, or have a configuration experience, in order to be visible from the catalog.

keywords.description: Keywords associated with this widget, non-filterable and invisible

lightboxOptions.description: Opt-in properties for customizing widget presentation in a "lightbox" dialog.

loadingImageUrl.description: Resource for a loading placeholder image on dashboard

name.description: User facing name of the widget type. Each widget must use a unique value here.

publisherName.description: Publisher Name of this kind of widget.

supportedScopes.description: Data contract required for the widget to function and to work in its container.

tags.description: Tags associated with this widget, visible on each widget and filterable.

typeId.description: Deprecated: locally unique developer-facing id of this kind of widget. ContributionId provides a globally unique identifier for widget types.

WidgetResponse.description: Response from RestAPI when saving and editing Widget

columnSpan.description: The Width of the widget, expressed in dashboard grid columns.

rowSpan.description: The height of the widget, expressed in dashboard grid rows.

WidgetsVersionedList.description: Wrapper class to support HTTP header generation using CreateResponse, ClientHeaderParameter and ClientResponseType in WidgetV2Controller

api-Version-preview.1.name: api-version
api-Version-preview.1.description: Version of the API to use.  This should be set to '7.2-preview.1' to use this version of the api.

api-Version-preview.2.name: api-version
api-Version-preview.2.description: Version of the API to use.  This should be set to '7.2-preview.2' to use this version of the api.

api-Version-preview.3.name: api-version
api-Version-preview.3.description: Version of the API to use.  This should be set to '7.2-preview.3' to use this version of the api.

accessToken.description: Personal access token. Use any value for the user name and the token as the password.

scopes.vso.dashboards: Grants the ability to read team dashboard information
scopes.vso.dashboards_manage: Grants the ability to manage team dashboard information
